game

Class Rules

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Rules

  • public abstract class Rules
extends java.lang.Object
    A placed Stone is valid if:
    1. it is located on a location where the Board is Feature.EMPTY, i.e.:
      1. it is not located outside the Board playable grid, i.e., where the Board is Feature.SIDE,
      2. it is not located on top of another Stone,
      3. it is not located outside the bounds of the full grid,
    2. it commits suicide: it will immediately be removed from the board (along with any group it may have been part of,
      1. if the suicide leads to the capture of a group of the opponent, the opponent group is removed from the board first, after which the suicide stone has liberties again and does not need to be removed from the board, as it will always have at least one liberty.
    3. it does not reproduce any previous board layout ((super) Ko rule).

    Rule names:

    Rule 1
    technical validity
    Rule 2
    dynamical validity
    Rule 3
    is called historical validity

    Note that the rules are honoured in their numerical order when playing a move. Also note that any technically valid move is also dynamically valid; if can be placed somewhere, it is valid. However, when a legal move is played, the stone itself or adjacent stones may become dynamically invalid; hence they are removed.

    Created by erik.huizinga on 27-1-17.

    • Method Detail

      • isTechnicallyValid

        public static boolean isTechnicallyValid(Board board,
                                         Move move)
        Determine technical validity of the specified Move on the specified Board. If invalid, any Observer instances of the Go game associated with the Board are notified about this through the setChangedAndNotifyObservers method of Go.
        Parameters:
        board - the Board.
        move - the Move.
        Returns:
        true if the Move is technically valid; false otherwise.

      • playWithDynamicalValidation

        static Board playWithDynamicalValidation(Board board,
                                         Move move)
        Play the specified Move on the specified Board and ensure dynamical validity of the Board. The specified Board is left untouched and a new Board is returned.
        Parameters:
        board - the Board.
        move - the Move to play.
        Returns:
        the dynamically valid Board with the Move played on it.

      • handleDynamicalValidity

        static java.util.List<Remove> handleDynamicalValidity(Board board,
                                                      PositionedMaterial positionedMaterial)
        Handle dynamical validity of the specified Board after playing PositionedMaterial. Any removed stones are returned as a List<Remove>.
        Parameters:
        board - the Board to validate.
        positionedMaterial - the PositionedMaterial that may have dynamically invalidated the Board.
        Returns:
        the List<Remove>.

      • isHistoricallyValid

        public static boolean isHistoricallyValid(Go go,
                                          Board board)
        Determine if the specified Board does not yet exists in the specified Go game's board history.
        Parameters:
        go - the Go game.
        board - the Board.
        Returns:
        true if the Move is historically valid; false otherwise.
